bibl.title: Coptic Writing Exercises in the Petrie Museum with a Concordance of its Published Coptic Texts.
bibl.note: The language of the texts is not always easy to identify, especially alphabets / alphabetic exercises that do not include any Coptic letters. The provenance of the ostraca is unknown, except for no. 7 (for which the catalogue records Thebes). - 1. O. London Univ. College Inv. 32823. Alphabet Practice / Pen Trials. - 2. Inv. 32831. Alphabet Practice / Pen Trials. - 3. Inv. 32879. Alphabet Practice / Pen Trials. - 4. Inv. 32765. Alphabet (partial). - 5. Inv. 62760. Alphabet. - 6. Inv. 62675. Syllabary? - 7. Inv. 32087. Name List. - 8. Inv. 32876. Epistolary Exercise. - 9. Inv. 62754. Epistolary Exercise. - 10. Inv. 62806. Epistolary Exercise. - 11. Inv. 62759. Practice Letter? - 12. Inv. 62680. Practice Text? - 13. Inv. 62740. Religious Composition. - Pp. 212-218: Concordance of Published Coptic and Bilingual Ostraca in the Petrie Museum of Archaeology.
bibl.seg: Jennifer Cromwell, Coptic Writing Exercises in the Petrie Museum with a Concordance of its Published Coptic Texts.

The language of the texts is not always easy to identify, especially alphabets / alphabetic exercises that do not include any Coptic letters. The provenance of the ostraca is unknown, except for no. 7 (for which the catalogue records Thebes). - 1. O. London Univ. College Inv. 32823. Alphabet Practice / Pen Trials. - 2. Inv. 32831. Name List. - 8. Inv. 32876. Epistolary Exercise. - 9. Inv. 62754. Epistolary Exercise. - 10. Inv. 62806. Epistolary Exercise. - 11. Inv. 62759. Practice Letter? - 12. Inv. 62680. Practice Text? - 13. Inv. 62740. Religious Composition. - Pp. 212-218: Concordance of Published Coptic and Bilingual Ostraca in the Petrie Museum of Archaeology.
